intro: Omphalodes chiangii, commonly known as the Chiang Mai omphalodes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fragrant, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
